citation.article-title: Pontirhabdus pectinivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from seawater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Pontirhabdus (Pon.ti.rhab′dus. L. n. pontus the sea; N.L. fem. n. rhabdus a rod, wand; N.L. fem. n. Pontirhabdus a rod that grows in the sea).
Gram-reaction-negative, oxidase- and catalase-positive and aerobic.
Cells are rods with rounded ends and are able to glide.
Produces non-diffusible carotenoid pigments, but flexirubin-type pigments are absent.
Requires sea salts, but not yeast extract, for growth.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 3-OH, iso-C15 : 1 G, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, anteiso-C15 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0.
The maximum absorption peak of pigments is at 452 nm and the next shoulder peak is at 480 nm.
A member of the family Flavobacteriaceae, class Flavobacteria, phylum ‘Bacteroidetes’. The type species is Pontirhabdus pectinivorans.
